turns.content: i had a mail chat with Gabriella somtimes in december last year
I'm sorry, I am not able to access or recall past conversations or emails. Is there something specific you would like to know or talk about related to your email with Gabriella?

this is the conversation The CommCare Community of Practice for Researchers
Inbox

Gabriella Stoudemire 
Nov 28, 2022, 10:02 PM
to me

Hi Ja'afar,

I hope you're doing well.

We'll be officially "launching" our Research Community of Practice on the CommCare Forum next month. It will be a space for researchers to share ideas, collaborate and troubleshoot.

I wanted you know about the launch in advance, so you can be one of the first to explore it and offer any wishes, feedback or suggestions –– otherwise, I hope you find it useful and that you feel encouraged to engage and contribute!

As of now, the topics included in the CoP are:
"Trusty Tips" –– regular CommCare tips to enhance your digital data collection journeys
Researcher Spotlight Series –– interviews with CommCare users about their work 
Your Research –– a space to share ideas & updates, or find opportunities to collaborate 
If you have any questions or feedback, please don't hesitate to reach out.

Warm regards!
Gabriella 
Gabriella Stoudemire
Strategy & Partnerships Director
Dimagi | www.dimagi.com
US: +1 917 498 5568
UK: +44 73 999 26494 
Ja'afar Lawal 
Nov 28, 2022, 11:07 PM
to Gabriella

Hi Gabriella, 

I am doing very fine. I hope you are doing well too. It is going to be very useful. I will be very much happy to be part of it, to explore and interact with like minds in CommCare. Earlier today, I tried to reach out to Kirti to discuss a topic raised by one of my CommCare student but unfortunately I got a reply that he no longer work with Dimagi. This will be a good forum for discussion and learning. 

Thanks 
Best Regards.
Ja'afar Lawal
Gabriella Stoudemire 
Nov 30, 2022, 7:19 PM
to me

Hi Ja'afar,
Thanks so much for your note. We'd love your feedback or participation for the Community of Practice! Please also feel free to share it with your network.
And yes, Kirti recently left. Please let me know if I can help answer any questions. 
It would be great to touch base again in the New Year to keep discussing in-person training if you're still interested.
Best,
Gabriella 

Ja'afar Lawal 
Dec 1, 2022, 11:15 PM
to Gabriella

Hi Gabriella,

Thank you for the opportunity. I will be very glad to participate and also share my feedback with other members of the community of practice. Sounds interesting already. 

And for the in-person training, I am very much interested. I recently leveraged on an opportunity and trained some M&E staff ministry of health during the material and newborn child health week. Though the training was brief but the interest is high. Looking forward to discuss with you on that. 
 
The question rised during one of my classes was that, whether it is possible to export barcodes and pictures in it's form not as a link?
 Thanks. 

Best regards
Ja'afar Lawal gtbank

The conversation you provided is an email exchange between you (Ja'afar Lawal) and Gabriella Stoudemire, where Gabriella is informing you about the launch of a research Community of Practice on the CommCare Forum. The Community of Practice is a space for researchers to share ideas, collaborate and troubleshoot. Gabriella also shares the topics that will be included in the Community of Practice, such as "Trusty Tips", Researcher Spotlight Series and "Your Research". You express your interest in the Community of Practice, and also ask about the possibility of exporting barcodes and pictures in their original form, rather than as a link. Gabriella also mentions that she would like to touch base with you again in the New Year to discuss in-person training.
I'm not sure what you would like me to continue on, Can you please provide more details or context on what you would like me to elaborate on?
Just draft a follow-up foŕme from that converstion

Sure, here is a sample follow-up email you could send based on the conversation you provided:

Subject: Follow-up on CommCare Research Community of Practice

Dear Gabriella,

I hope this email finds you well. I wanted to follow up on our previous conversation regarding the launch of the Research Community of Practice on the CommCare Forum.

I am still very excited about the opportunity to participate in the community and I am looking forward to engaging with like-minded individuals and sharing ideas. I am also glad to hear that the community will include topics such as "Trusty Tips" and the Researcher Spotlight Series.

I also wanted to bring up the question I had regarding exporting barcodes and pictures in their original form. If possible, it would be great if you could provide me with more information on this topic or direct me to a resource where I can find more information.

Additionally, I am still very interested in discussing in-person training opportunities. Let me know when would be a good time for us to schedule a call or meeting to discuss further.

Thank you for your time and I look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Ja'afar Lawal

Note: you might want to make any additional modifications that suits your need.
